action.action-desc: Mrs. Radewagen (for herself and Mr. Case) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the South Pacific Tuna Act of 1988, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the South Pacific Tuna Treaty Act of 2023.
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 2. Amendment of South Pacific Tuna Act of 1988.
Sec. 11. Reporting requirements; disclosure of information.
Sec. 16. Disposition of fees, penalties, forfeitures, and other moneys.

section.header: Amendment of South Pacific Tuna Act of 1988
section.text: Except as otherwise expressly provided, wherever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the South Pacific Tuna Act of 1988 (16 U.S.C. 973 et seq.).

subsection.text: Section 2(4) (16 U.S.C. 973(4)) is amended by striking described in paragraph 1(a) of Annex I of and inserting noticed and in effect in accordance with.

Section 2(5) (16 U.S.C. 973(5)) is amended by striking of the closed areas identified in Schedule 2 of Annex I of and inserting area within the jurisdiction of a Pacific Island Party that is closed to vessels pursuant to a national law of that Pacific Island Party and is noticed and in effect in accordance with.

subsection.header: Forwarding and transmittal of vessel license application
subsection.text: Section 9(b) (16 U.S.C. 973g(b)) is amended to read as follows:

In accordance with subsection (e), and except as provided in subsection (f), the Secretary shall forward a vessel license application to the Administrator whenever such application is in accordance with application procedures established by the Secretary.
Section 9(c) (16 U.S.C. 973g(c)) is amended to read as follows:
Fees required under the Treaty shall be paid in accordance with the Treaty and any procedures established by the Secretary.

subsection.header: Minimum fees required To be received in initial year of implementation for forwarding and transmittal of license applications
subsection.text: Section 9 (16 U.S.C. 973g) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (f);
by redesignating subsections (g) and (h) as subsections (f) and (g), respectively;
by amending subsection (f), as so redesignated, to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of State, may determine that a license application should not be forwarded to the Administrator if—

paragraph.text: the application is not in accordance with the Treaty or the procedures established by the Secretary; or
the owner or charterer—

subparagraph.text: is the subject of proceedings under the bankruptcy laws of the United States, unless reasonable financial assurances have been provided to the Secretary;
has not established to the satisfaction of the Secretary that the fishing vessel is fully insured against all risks and liabilities normally provided in maritime liability insurance; or
has not paid any penalty which has become final, assessed by the Secretary in accordance with this Act.

paragraph.text: in subsection (g), as so redesignated—

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: chapter 12113 of title 46, United States Code;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by inserting of 1972 after Marine Mammal Protection Act;
in paragraph (3), by inserting of 1972 after Marine Mammal Protection Act; and
in the matter that follows paragraph (3), by striking any vessel documented and all that follows and inserting the following:

quoted-block.quoted-block-continuation-text: any vessel documented under the laws of the United States as of the date of enactment of the Fisheries Act of 1995 for which a license has been issued under subsection (a) may fish for tuna in the Licensing Area, and on the high seas and in waters subject to the jurisdiction of the United States west of 146° west longitude and east of 129.5° east longitude in accordance with international law, subject to the provisions of the Treaty, this Act, and other applicable law, provided that no such vessel intentionally deploys a purse seine net to encircle any dolphin or other marine mammal in the course of fishing.

section.text: Section 12 (16 U.S.C. 973j) is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall keep confidential and may not disclose the following information, except in accordance with subsection (b):

paragraph.text: Information provided to the Secretary by the Administrator that the Administrator has designated confidential.
Information collected by observers.
Information submitted to the Secretary by any person in compliance with the requirements of this Act.

subsection.text: The Secretary may disclose information described in subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: if disclosure is ordered by a court;
if the information is used by a Federal employee—

subparagraph.text: in support of the homeland and national security missions of the Coast Guard as defined in section 888 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 468);

paragraph.text: if the information is used by a Federal employee or an employee of the Fishery Management Council for Treaty administration or fishery management and monitoring;
to the Administrator, in accordance with the requirements of the Treaty and this Act;

to the secretariat or equivalent of an international fisheries management organization of which the United States is a member, in accordance with the requirements or decisions of such organization, and insofar as possible, in accordance with an agreement that prevents public disclosure of the identity of any person that submits such information;
if the Secretary has obtained written authorization from the person providing such information, and disclosure does not violate other requirements of this Act; or
in an aggregate or summary form that does not directly or indirectly disclose the identity of any person that submits such information.
